keyPolicies.policyDescription:
- Ban zero hour contracts
- Pension triple lock guaranteed
- No tax increases if you earn under £80,000
- A £10 minimum wage from 18+ by 2020
- Public ownership of bus, rail, energy, water and Royal Mail

- No student tuition fees from September 2017
- Real funding increase of 6% per pupil in schools
- Free hot lunch for all primary school children
- Free child care: 30 hrs for all 2-4 year olds
- Free college courses for adult learners for life

- Stop the Dorset “STP” plan to close hospital units & GPs
- Invest £38bn more in the NHS and integrated Social Care
- Give NHS workers the pay rise they deserve
- Reintroduce nurse training bursaries
- End the scandalous neglect of mental health

mentions.candidate: Steve moved to Poole with his family 11 years ago, to enjoy the clean air, countryside and beaches of Dorset.

issues.labourEmployment:
- Ban zero hour contracts
- Pension triple lock guaranteed
- No tax increases if you earn under £80,000
- A £10 minimum wage from 18+ by 2020

leaflet.personalStatement: Steve moved to Poole with his family 11 years ago, to enjoy the clean air, countryside and beaches of Dorset. His youngest was born at the now threatened maternity unit in Poole Hospital, joining her elder brother and sister to complete the family. Steve’s wife is an English teacher and Labour campaigner. Steve is a Project Manager who has worked in manufacturing industries for 25 years, including a spell at the RNLI in Poole. He commutes regularly to London now, having faced the insecurities typical of modern short-term contract work in recent times.

examples: - Invest £38bn more in the NHS and integrated Social Care
End the scandalous neglect of mental health
- Stop the Dorset “STP” plan to close hospital units & GPs

- Ban zero hour contracts
- No student tuition fees from September 2017
